title: Liverpool striker Daniel Sturridge challenged to nail down a starting role in Sadio Mane's absence
text:
Sport Liverpool striker Daniel Sturridge challenged to nail down a starting role in Sadio Mane's absence Boss Jurgen Klopp wants the Englishman to use this opportunity to show how good he is — starting at Southampton in Wednesday's EFL Cup semi-final first leg Share Sturridge at Liverpool training ahead of their Wednesday trip to St Mary's (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jurgen Klopp has told Daniel Sturridge to seize the chance to become Liverpool's main man. 
The striker has been handed the chance to prove himself the leader of the Reds ' title challenge with Sadio Mane away on international duty for the next month. 
Sturridge leads the line at Southampton in the first leg of an EFL Cup semi-final on Wednesday, and Klopp says: "If Daniel is fit are there any arguments here ever about his quality? No." 
Sturridge's injury problems have meant he has been far from a regular starter under Klopp, despite his obvious quality. Mane may not return until mid-February, depending how Senegal do in Gabon (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
And it has also led to him being linked with a move to the likes of West Ham and West Brom — even though he is quite possibly the most gifted English striker of his generation. 
Klopp, who watched Sturridge score twice in a 6-1 away thrashing of Saints in this same competition last season, added: “How good he can be depends on a lot of things. A repeat of Sturridge's 2015 League Cup display at Southampton would do Klopp nicely (Photo: Getty) 
"His talent and skill there is absolutely no doubt about. Cleverness. Everything you need on the pitch... Absolutely outstanding. 
"But he has often not been enough fit. 
“So that is another important part. But that is all. View gallery 
"If he stays fit, there is the whole thing and we don’t talk about other clubs, another level, things like this. 
“From my point of view, until now – even when he didn’t score – he made really good performances. Even when he didn’t score he was so important in a lot of these games. He fits really well in our style of play. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
